Entries.default: "Were it me, Aloth, I'd be letting the lass out to play more."
"You be looking at this the wrong way, lad, like she be someone else inside your head."
"Shame I weren't at that animancy trial. My mind would've cut Thaos' plot to bloody ribbons."
"I worry about you, Edér. There be a thing or three out here that you shouldn't be aiming to pet."
"You had me right fooled, farmer."
"I be half worried about our friends from the Reach, Maia."
"An old salt swaggers in with a ship's wheel sticking out of his pants..."
"Sometimes, lass, I be wondering why you muck about with this motley lot."
"Oi lass, can you be learning me how to do that big blue sword thing?"
"You know, lass, some might be saying your bellicosity towards the gods be a bit ridiculous, you having parleyed with them and all."
"So how would you be saying 'barnacle-arsed bilge-swallow?'"
"It is not every day I meet a sailor who gives no praise to Ngati."
"What if we be inviting Eothas on a big, blue, and beautiful tour of anywhere but Deadfire?"
"Gods, lad. I could live forever and never be tiring of these islands."
"Once, I woke up in naught but a nightshirt in a hold full up of squid."
"Glad you and Maia be shaking the sheets, Xoti. She be a good lass, under the everything."
"Don't I know it. Never felt so lucky in my whole life."
"That's nothing. Twice in one week, I woke in a dug-up grave. Buck naked. Coffin busted. No corpse to be found."
"You ever thought about changing the color of your fur? Murkburries'll stain your skin for weeks."
"You'd be better off mooning after someone with half a thought between their ears, lass."
"You can't dictate what the heart wants, Serafen. Thought you of all people would know that."
"It isn't you, and I didn't ask."
"Could make a right nice excuse to be exploring your... well, everything, aye?"
"You do realize you're not the first ill-mannered orlan to suggest that."
"Indeed, it's a wonder we ever stopped Thaos without you."
"Don't let it discourage, lad. I'd wager silver you can keep up."
"How generous of you."
"Putting those cipher skills to work, aren't we?"
"The pair of you share a soul, one in the same. She be your feminine side."
"And both of us are equally capable of putting your snooping nose where it belongs."
"Or mayhaps you be hers."
"Hey, it was dark, I only saw the back of your head. I thought you were some huge island squirrel."
"This ain't about me, farmer!"
"How's that?"
"About the Watcher. Parently had him fooled, too."
Entries.female: "About the Watcher. Parently had her fooled, too."

Entries.default: "Well, I'm not much for fooling. Unless it's more like pouring tree sap in someone's breeches."
"We are both 'mucking' about with them, are we not?"
"Aye, but I be a furry blue pirate, and you be... well, you."
"I am a servant. My country has needs and I tend to them as best I can, regardless of company."
"Is this one of those colorful pirate expressions?"
"Nay, gods, nay. Were literal as a Dyrwoodan schoolmarm."
"In that case, no."
"If you had spoken to them, you'd find them ridiculous, too. Anyway, what good have your prayers to Ondra ever done?"
"Better being safe than drowned."
"I wouldn't."
"But were you to be saying it, how would you?"
"I'd get a pirate to do it by grabbing one and sticking a sword up their -"
"But they were doing fine without our help."
"Saying, though - go too long without release, you risk the bits getting all clogged up."
"Ah. We can only watch and pray they help themselves."
"It's driving him nuts."
"New swabby be asking the first mate, do galleys like this be sinking often?"
"Usually it's just the once. Even Ishi knows that one."
"Gods, lass, you be no fun at all."
"She ain't sunk me yet, lad."
"It be a right shame you be such a cold, calculating crabhatcher, Maia."
"I don't speak fur pirate, but I'll take that as a compliment."
"Drinks later, aye?"
"Wouldn't miss it."
"You would have to be large enough to grab his attention, I say."
"I be big enough, lad. Where it counts."
"Ekera. The beaches of Ori o Koīki, the sands of Poko Kohara..."
"The lads walking them beaches, the lasses with sand on their asses."
"Ekera. Them as well."
"And that was before the dreams started."
"Only twice? And here I were thinking you were exciting."
"The heart can be a right stupid git sometimes. It don't always deserve your listening."
"Think I were born blue, eh? Think being this pretty come natural?"
"Well, dang, Serafen! I never knew you were so fancy."
"But mayhaps I'll be giving them murkberries a go. Ain't never been maroon before."
"Aye, ma'am, understood, forget I asked."
